net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.validation

Class NumberValidator

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.validation.NumberValidator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Validator
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DoubleValidator, FloatValidator, IntegerValidator, LongValidator

    public abstract class NumberValidator
extends Object
implements Validator
    Abstract validator for FieldComponents in which a Number is entered. If the value to be validated is empty or null then the validator will accept it. Use the RequiredValueValidator in a CompositeValidator to require a value to be entered. The base functionallity for the concrete subclasses of this class is to ensure that the value in the Field can be parsed into the desired number format. In addition, restrictions can be applied to the resulting number by use of one or more NumberRestrictions. Serveral are provided as static fields of this class for convenience. Restrictions can also be created using one of the static createXXXRestriction methods, or new ones can be defined. LocalizedObjectKey propName = // get the name of the property. // Validator that requires the value to be a float parsable, positive number that is less than or equal to 100. NumberValidator val = new FloatValidator(propName, NumberValidator.POSITIVE_RESTRICTION, NumberValidator.createUpperBoundInclusiveRestriction(100)); Default messages are definied for number format violations as well as for all of the convenience NumberRestrictions. These will look best if the property name is provided.
    Author:
    Matt Culver (mculver@i2rd.com)

        public boolean isComponentValidationSupported(Component component)
        Determine if this validator instance can be used with the given component. Returns true for Field. Override to return true for other classes and override getComponentValue(Component) to support the component.
        Specified by:
